cont.entity_a: Tight on the head initially but relaxes over time. Very comfortable even for long listening sessions. No ear fatigue over long listening periods.
cont.entity_b: No problem using over hearing aids. Uncomfortable for long periods; causes pain and sweating. Earcups large enough to cover ears comfortably. Terribly uncomfortable; causes pain after a few minutes. Heavy and tight; uncomfortable fit.

cont.entity_a: Absolutely beautiful sound out of the box. Sound quality is amazing from highs to lows. Crystal clear vocals and deep bass. Extremely clear and the frequency response is phenomenal. Incredibly clean and distinct sound. Sound is smooth and balanced with incredible clarity and detail. Sound quality better than Bose and Beats. Audiophile-grade sound with warm and detailed bass. Sound quality is leagues ahead of gaming headsets. Sound is warm and natural.
cont.entity_b: Sound isn't hi-fidelity but works for listening to interviews. Audio is extremely muddy and muffled. Sound quality feels cheap and brittle. Sound quality and lighter weight design are better in Koss UR40. Good sound quality for the price. Sound quality is awesome. High quality sound for a lower-priced set.

cont.entity_a: Sounds great but cheaply made; left side started cutting out after 6 months. Durable with replaceable ear pads and cable. Build quality is decent but not the best.
cont.entity_b: Not very sturdy; one channel stopped working quickly. Hinge broke after 3 months of use. Very long-lasting headphones.

cont.entity_a: Open back design allows breathability. Open back design allows sound leakage. Open back design not suitable for noisy environments. Open back design allows ambient sound in. Open back design not suitable for public use.
cont.entity_b: Heavy, bulky design with 'Ok' slightly muffled sound quality. Collapsible design for easy transport.

cont.entity_a: Requires a pretty powerful amp to drive them. Requires a proper amp to get the best sound. Requires a decent amp and DAC for full potential. Requires a good amp for best performance. Requires a solid amp and DAC. Requires a headphone amplifier to reach full potential. Requires a good amp and DAC for optimal performance.
cont.entity_b: Cans need an amp to bring out full flavor. Good highs, mid, and bass after using an amp.
Good deal for the money. Great quality for the price. Good sound quality for the price. High quality sound for a lower-priced set.

cont.entity_a: Do not cancel noise or isolate from noise due to open-back design. Not ideal for recording due to sound leakage.
cont.entity_b: Good sound cancellation and comfort. Filters out lots of noise. Sound is good but not noise-canceling.

cont.entity_a: Clamp force is a little tight. Tight fit initially but becomes comfortable.

cont.entity_b: Instructions were misleading; no arrows on the headphones.
Long cord is an advantage. Cord is long for maneuverability. Cord is long and the volume control works well.
Volume control is awesome. Volume control works great.

cont.entity_a: Soundstage is full, broad, and wonderful with classical, rock, jazz. Sound stage isn't big but well defined. Sound stage is spacious with great imaging and instrument separation.

Pleasantly warm listening experience without too much bass. Clear, bright highs and just the right amount of bass. Bass is tight and controlled. Bass could be a little stronger. Sound is towards the warmer side. Not ideal for bass-heavy music.
